body:
A child riding a bike in Warren died Wednesday night after being  struck by a car, police said.
Warren police officers said the bicyclist had been riding near Nine Mile and Weller about 6:30 p.m. when the youth was struck.
The youth, described in broadcast reports as a 13-year-old, was pronounced dead shortly after the collision.
The driver stopped at the scene and cooperated with investigators. Alcohol was not believed to be a factor in the accident, which is under investigation, police said.
Police gave no other details.
headline: Warren police: Child on bike struck, killed
subheadline: Youth riding near Nine Mile and Weller hit by car on Wednesday night; accident under investigation
summary: A child riding a bike in Warren died Wednesday night after being  struck by a car, police said.
Warren police officers said the bicyclist had been riding near Nine Mile and Weller about 6:30 p.m. when the youth was struck.
Alcohol was not believed to be a factor in the accident, which is under investigation, police said.
